newsitem.title: USA: D'Arcy to merge Toronto office with Bensimon Byrne.
newsitem.headline: D'Arcy to merge Toronto office with Bensimon Byrne.

text.p: D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles Communications said Thursday that it plans to merge its Toronto office with Bensimon Byrne, a three-and-a-half year old independent agency.
D'Arcy said combined revenues for the merged Bensimon Byrne/D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles will be more than $12 million in 1997, making it the 15th largest agency in Canada.
It will have about 100 people, and its clients will include Proctor & Gamble, Blockbuster Video and Spectrum United Mutual Funds.
The company said Jack Bensimon would become president, and Peter Byrne will become chief creative officer.
D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles is a company of The MacManus Group.
